Package org.lwjgl.bgfx

Contains bindings to the bgfx library.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BGFXCacheReadCallbackI
    Reads cached item.
    BGFXCacheReadSizeCallbackI
    Returns size of cached item.
    BGFXCacheWriteCallbackI
    Writes cached item.
    BGFXCaptureBeginCallbackI
    Called when capture begins.
    BGFXCaptureEndCallbackI
    Called when capture ends.
    BGFXCaptureFrameCallbackI
    Captured frame.
    BGFXFatalCallbackI
    If fatal code is not FATAL_DEBUG_CHECK this callback is called on unrecoverable error.
    BGFXReallocCallbackI
    Allocates memory.
    BGFXReleaseFunctionCallbackI
    Instances of this interface may be passed to the make_ref_release method.
    BGFXScreenShotCallbackI
    Screenshot captured.
    BGFXTraceVarArgsCallbackI
    Prints a debug message.

Package org.lwjgl.bgfx Description

Contains bindings to the bgfx library.

The bgfx documentation can be found online here. The API reference is available here.

The bgfx library is very customizable and can be tailored to specific needs. For this reason, the lwjgl-bgfx artifact does not include any prebuilt native libraries.

To compile your own version, follow the build instructions for Windows, Linux and MacOS. Please ensure to use the --with-shared-lib configuration to create a shared library. Just copy the compiled library found in <bgfx>/.build/<platform>/bin/ to the classpath of your LWJGL application.

By default, lwjgl-bgfx searches for bgfx[32].dll (Windows), libbgfx.so (Linux) or libbgfx.dylib (MacOS). This can be customized by defining org.lwjgl.bgfx.libname.
